frontmatter.title: A Multiplatform approach to MVI
frontmatter.description: As mobile applications have become massive pieces of code, we have always looked over architectures as a sole source of maintenance and making code easier for us. We have moved through cycles of architectures such as MVC, MVP, MVVM - MV* is a more appropriate acronym.

frontmatter.title: Targeting Kotlin for both Android and iOS
frontmatter.description: Kotlin has been traditionally used as a language for JVM based platforms and has become highly popular in Android ecosystem. As the language matures, it is knocking on new frontiers — platforms other than JVM, one of them being iOS.

frontmatter.title: Kotlin Serialization Library
frontmatter.description: Kotlin has recently released a library for serialization. To put things in perspective, before this there was no serialization lib provided by kotlin but you could use any platform supported serialization libraries with Kotlin classes(eg. Gson for JVM/Android).

frontmatter.title: Playing with Kotlin Higher Order Functions
frontmatter.description: One of the cool things in Kotlin is having ability to pass around functions as objects. That’s where higher order functions come and allow us to write code more declaratively.
